column4: okay I was here a couple of hours ago and I am wondering if a 5GB HD is sufficient memory to install ubuntu
yes, but you won't have enuff space for more software
okay I did the live CD, but after showing the ubuntu logo screen...it's now showing a blank screen. is that normal?
blank screen?
blank black screen
I did the cntrl. + alt. f1 cmd, and it says "ACPI, no DMI BIOS year" acpi is required to acpi? what does that mean?
I think you have BIOS issues, try fixing the hour in your BIOS
what's the command?
reboot and smash either Del or F1
okay what's the command?
lol, just press it at boot-time
it's still loading...should I just wait?
no, reboot, and tap F1 or Del keys
okay I just change the cloak right?
yup, change it to actual time
and that's it?
Maybe
by installing the live CD is it best to just install ubuntu with changes or without changes to HD, since it is an old computer
How is it'
64 RAM, 6.4 GB
so, make an ext3 partition andi install
how do I do that?
Alt+F2 gparted
this is before or after the install?
